intro: Cicer pimpinellifolium, commonly known as the chickpea, is an annual legume native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and elongated pods containing numerous seeds. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability through symbiotic bacteria in its root nodules. Its seeds are rich in protein and are widely used in various cuisines around the world. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates.
